{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sunlight, specifically ultraviolet (UV) radiation, is a well-known risk factor for several types of skin cancer. Squamous cell carcinoma, malignant melanoma, and basal cell carcinoma are all types of skin cancer that can be caused by excessive exposure to sunlight. On the other hand, a port-wine stain is a type of birthmark that appears at birth or in the first or second week of life. It looks like a port-wine stain because of the pink or red color. It is not caused by sunlight.", "answer_choice": "A, B, C"}
